title: Time/Space & Metaphysical Structure
description: Explore Ra's profound teachings on the dual structure of reality: space/time (physical incarnation) and time/space (metaphysical existence). This advanced path covers what happens between lives, the nature of the Higher Self, and why working 'in darkness' in physical incarnation is so valuable.

sections.markdown:
Ra teaches that reality has two complementary aspects: space/time and time/space. Space/time is the physical world we know—where objects are tangible and time flows sequentially. Time/space is its metaphysical analog—where time becomes tangible (all times simultaneous) and space becomes fluid.

Understanding this duality illuminates both incarnate experience and the existence between incarnations.

sections.text: The hallmark of time/space is the inequity between time and space. In your space/time the spatial orientation of material causes a tangible framework for illusion. In time/space the inequity is upon the shoulders of that property known to you as time.
sections.context: Ra contrasts the two aspects of reality—in space/time, space is tangible; in time/space, time is tangible.
highlight: property known to you as time

sections.markdown:
In our familiar space/time reality, we can move through space but are 'stuck' in time—it flows at a fixed rate, and we experience only the present moment. In time/space, this is reversed. Entities can review all times simultaneously (past, present, probable futures) but are 'located' in a relatively fixed position.

This reversal has profound implications for understanding what happens between lives and how the Higher Self operates.

sections.text: In time/space, which is precisely as much of your self as is space/time, all times are simultaneous just as, in your geography, your cities and villages are all functioning, bustling, and alive with entities going about their business at once.
sections.context: Ra offers an analogy: just as all places exist simultaneously in space, all times exist simultaneously in time/space.
highlight: precisely as much of your self as is space/time

sections.markdown:
Ra's analogy is helpful: in space/time, all locations exist at once—London, Tokyo, and New York are all there simultaneously, though we can only be in one place. In time/space, all times exist at once—your birth, your death, and all between exist simultaneously. This is not mere philosophy; it's the actual structure of the metaphysical realms.

This is why between incarnations, entities can review their entire life from an outside perspective and plan future incarnations with knowledge of 'what works.'

sections.text: I perceive a basic miscalculation upon your part in that time/space is no more homogenous than space/time. It is as complex and complete a system of illusions, dances, and pattern as is space/time and has as structured a system of what you may call natural laws.
sections.context: Ra corrects the assumption that time/space is simple—it is just as complex as physical reality.

sections.markdown:
When the physical body dies, the mind/body/spirit complex transitions from space/time to time/space. There, in what might be called the 'inner planes' or 'metaphysical realm,' a structured process of healing and review occurs before any new incarnation is chosen.

This is not a haphazard process but a carefully orchestrated opportunity for learning and planning.

sections.text: In these metaphysical planes there is a great deal of what you call time which is used to review and re-review the biases and learn/teachings of a prior, as you would call it, space/time incarnation.
sections.context: Ra describes the primary activity between incarnations: reviewing and learning from the completed life.

sections.markdown:
The review process involves seeing the just-completed incarnation in full—not just the events, but the choices, the moments of contact with the Creator, and the missed opportunities. This is done 'against the backdrop of the mind/body/spirit complex total experience'—meaning all of one's incarnations.

The purpose is not judgment but understanding: what was learned? What remains to be learned? What will best serve continued evolution?

sections.text: The process involves seeing in full the experience, seeing it against the backdrop of the mind/body/spirit complex total experience, forgiving the self for all missteps as regards the missed guideposts during the incarnation and, finally, the careful assessment of the next necessities for learning.
sections.context: Ra outlines the steps of the between-incarnation process.
highlight: careful assessment of the next necessities

sections.markdown:
Self-forgiveness is essential to this process. Without it, the entity cannot clearly assess what comes next. The process is conducted with the aid of helpers—guides, teachers, and most importantly, the Higher Self—until the entity has developed enough awareness to participate consciously in all decisions.

Healing also occurs in time/space. Distortions and trauma from physical experience are processed in the more fluid metaphysical environment.

sections.text: The advantage of time/space is that of the fluidity of the grand overview. The advantage of space/time is that, working in darkness with a tiny candle, one may correct imbalances.
sections.context: Ra contrasts the advantages of each realm—overview in time/space, change in space/time.
highlight: working in darkness with a tiny candle

sections.markdown:
This is a crucial teaching: in time/space, you can see everything but change nothing. In space/time, you can see almost nothing but change everything. The incarnate state, despite its darkness and confusion, is uniquely valuable because it is where actual work can be done.

This is why we incarnate again and again—not because we're 'trapped' but because physical incarnation offers opportunities that the metaphysical realms cannot.

sections.markdown:
One of Ra's most profound teachings is the nature of the Higher Self. Your Higher Self is not a separate guide or teacher—it is you, specifically you in mid-sixth density. It is your own future self looking back through time to offer guidance to your current incarnation.

This creates a beautiful loop: your future wholeness guides your present growth, which creates that future wholeness.

sections.text: The higher self is the entity of mid-sixth density which, turning back, offers this service to its self.
sections.context: Ra defines the Higher Self as your own sixth-density self, serving your current incarnation.
highlight: offers this service to its self

sections.markdown:
The Higher Self operates from mid-sixth density, where love and wisdom have been balanced and unified. From this vantage point, it can see the entire path you have traveled and will travel. Yet it does not control or manipulate—the first distortion (free will) remains paramount.

The Higher Self protects when possible, guides when asked, and programs incarnational lessons when the entity is not yet conscious enough to do so itself.

sections.text: The Higher Self does not manipulate its past selves. It protects when possible and guides when asked, but the force of free will is paramount.
sections.context: Ra clarifies the Higher Self's respectful relationship with its past selves.

sections.markdown:
Because of the simultaneity of time in time/space, the Higher Self's existence is not contradicted by the fact that you haven't 'become' it yet. From its perspective, all your incarnations exist simultaneously. It can offer guidance to any point in your development because all points exist 'now' in time/space.

This is also why guidance from the Higher Self can feel so reliable—it knows where you're going because, from its perspective, you've already arrived.

sections.text: You are existing at all levels simultaneously. It is specifically correct that your higher self is you in mid-sixth density and, in your way of measuring what you know of as time, your higher self is your self in your future.
sections.context: Ra explains the paradox of the Higher Self—it is simultaneously your future self and present with you now.
highlight: your higher self is you in mid-sixth density

sections.markdown:
Time/space is not a single homogenous realm but has structure and variety. Ra describes it as having 'natural laws' of its own—different regions serve different purposes, and entities exist in locations appropriate to their vibratory level and current needs.

The term 'inner planes' refers to these time/space regions associated with each density.

sections.text: Time/space is no more homogenous than space/time. It is as complex and complete a system of illusions, dances, and pattern as is space/time and has as structured a system of what you may call natural laws.
sections.context: Ra emphasizes the complexity and structure of time/space.

sections.markdown:
Each density has its time/space analog. When you transition from space/time at death, you enter the time/space appropriate to your density and vibratory level. The third-density inner planes are where most humans experience the between-incarnation state.

Different regions serve different functions: healing zones, review areas, planning spaces, and more. Guides and helpers operate in these regions, assisting entities in their processing and planning.

sections.text: Each entity is located in a somewhat immobile state much as you are located in space/time in a somewhat immobile state in time. In this immobile space the entity has been placed by the form-maker and higher self so that it may be in the proper configuration for learn/teaching.
sections.context: Ra describes how entities are 'placed' in appropriate time/space locations for their learning.
highlight: placed by the form-maker and higher self

sections.markdown:
The 'form-maker' that Ra mentions is a fascinating concept—an aspect of the entity that creates the appropriate form or location for the between-incarnation experience. Working together with the Higher Self, it ensures the entity is positioned for optimal learning and healing.

This placement is not random or punitive but precisely calibrated to serve the entity's evolution.

sections.text: There is a dimension in which time does not have sway. In this dimension, the mind/body/spirit in its eternal dance of the present may be seen in totality... This mind/body/spirit complex totality functions as, shall we say, a resource for what you perhaps would call the Higher Self.
sections.context: Ra explains how the complete self across all incarnations exists in time/space and serves as a resource for the Higher Self's guidance.
highlight: dimension in which time does not have sway

sections.markdown:
The mind/body/spirit complex totality is a profound concept: it is the complete you, encompassing all your incarnations—past, present, and probable future—existing simultaneously in time/space. This totality serves as a resource for the Higher Self, which draws upon this vast experience to guide each individual incarnation appropriately.

You are not just this one life. You are the sum of all your lives, all your choices, all your learnings—and this totality exists now in time/space, available as a resource for your current growth.

sections.text: A construct of thought was formed in time/space. This portion of time/space is that which approaches the speed of light. In time/space, at this approach, the conditions are such that time becomes infinite and mass ceases.
sections.context: Ra describes the physics-like nature of time/space, where different regions have different properties.

sections.markdown:
Ra's description reveals that time/space has gradients and regions with different properties, much like space/time has different physical environments. Near the boundary between time/space and space/time—where light exists—the properties change in ways that allow transition between realms.

This is not mere mysticism but a coherent framework for understanding metaphysical existence.

sections.markdown:
Ra repeatedly emphasizes the unique value of incarnate experience. Despite its confusion and suffering—or rather, because of them—space/time is where the real work of evolution occurs. The darkness of the veil, combined with the ability to make choices, creates conditions unavailable anywhere else in creation.

This is why beings choose to incarnate again and again.

sections.text: In time/space, upon the other hand, it is not possible to correct any unbalanced actions but rather to perceive the imbalances and thusly forgive the self for that which is. The decisions then are made to set up the possibility/probabilities of correcting these imbalances in what you call future space/time experiences.
sections.context: Ra explains why incarnation is necessary—only in space/time can imbalances be corrected.
highlight: correcting these imbalances in future space/time

sections.markdown:
In time/space, you can see everything but change nothing. You can perceive your imbalances clearly, forgive yourself, and understand—but you cannot act to correct them. Only by returning to space/time, with its veil and confusion, can actual transformation occur.

This is why physical incarnation is a precious opportunity, not a punishment or trap.

sections.text: The advantage of space/time is that, working in darkness with a tiny candle, one may correct imbalances.
sections.context: Ra poetically describes the unique gift of incarnate experience.

sections.markdown:
The 'tiny candle' is your awareness, your consciousness operating within the veil. It is small compared to the vast light of full knowledge available in time/space, but it has something that grand light lacks: the power to change.

This is why seeking is so valuable—not because it will give you complete answers (it won't, not in space/time), but because the very act of seeking in darkness, of choosing love in uncertainty, is the work itself.

**Key implications of this teaching:**

- **Physical life is valuable**: Don't wish it away; it offers unique opportunities
- **Confusion is not failure**: The veil's darkness is the price of the power to change
- **Small choices matter**: Each decision made 'by candlelight' shapes your path
- **The goal is not escape**: But rather full engagement with incarnate opportunity

sections.text: Since the concepts of space/time, or physics, and time/space, or metaphysics, are mechanical they are not central to the spiritual evolution of the mind/body/spirit complex. The study of love and light is far more productive in its motion towards unity.
sections.context: Ra reminds us that while understanding structure is interesting, practicing love is what matters.
highlight: study of love and light is far more productive

sections.markdown:
**Practical Example: The Review Process**

Imagine a soul—let's call him Michael—who has just transitioned from a completed lifetime. In that life, Michael was often harsh and critical toward his family, believing he was helping them 'toughen up.' He ignored many opportunities for tenderness.

**In time/space (the between-life state):**

Michael now sees his life in full. Not just his actions, but their effects—the pain his children felt, the distance his wife experienced, the love he could have given but withheld. He sees it all simultaneously, without the veil's protection. It's overwhelming, but there is no judgment from outside—only his own growing understanding.

Guides help him process. He reviews specific moments: the time his daughter showed him her artwork and he criticized it, when he might have praised. The time his wife reached for his hand and he pulled away. He feels both sides now—what he felt, what they felt.

Self-forgiveness comes slowly. He sees that his harshness came from his own fear, his own pain from childhood. He wasn't evil—he was wounded and unknowing. He forgives the child he was, the man he became.

But here's the crucial insight: **he cannot change any of it from time/space**. He can see, understand, forgive—but not act differently. The moments are complete.

**Planning the next incarnation:**

Working with his Higher Self and guides, Michael plans circumstances for his next life that will offer opportunities to learn tenderness: perhaps a sensitive child who will require gentleness, or a partner whose love language is words of affirmation. The catalyst will be precisely calibrated.

Then Michael returns to space/time—forgetting all of this, facing the same patterns without memory, armed only with a subtle inclination toward what he came to learn.

This is why incarnation matters. This is why the darkness serves. In the next life, when Michael faces the choice—criticism or compassion—he can actually choose differently. That choice, made 'by candlelight,' transforms his being in ways that clear sight alone never could.

completionReflection: You have explored the dual structure of reality—space/time and time/space—and the profound purposes each serves. Remember Ra's teaching: the study of love and light is more productive than understanding mechanics. But mechanics understood in service of love become a map for the journey. May you appreciate your time 'working in darkness with a tiny candle,' knowing that each choice made here, each act of love offered in uncertainty, is precisely the work your Higher Self is guiding you toward. The darkness is not your enemy—it is the very condition that makes your growth possible.
